lines.text: Kids and baseball - I guess they kinda go together, don't they? Like ham and eggs, or Boston and baked beans.

That's something every healthy, happy youngster loves - loves to step up to the old plate and belt one over the fence, or through somebody's window. I guess it's quite a question who gets the biggest kick out of it - the junior Red Soxers out there, playin' ball, or their proud mamas and papas, cheerin' 'em on from the grandstand.
